畭字的基本解释

畭
shē
古同“畬1”。

畭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yú］
［《廣韻》以諸切，平魚，以。］
亦作“畭1”。
(1)开垦过三年的田地，熟田。《诗·周颂·臣工》：“亦又何求？如何新畬。”毛传：“田，二歲曰新，三歲曰畬。”一说为开垦过二年的田地。后泛指田地。
(2)耕翻土地使成熟田。
[②]［shē］
［《廣韻》式車切，平麻，書。］
亦作“畭2”。亦作“畲1”。亦作“畲2”。
(1)焚烧田地里的草木，用草木灰做肥料的原始耕作方法。
(2)泛指粗放耕种。
(3)指粗放耕种的田地。
(4)量词。
(5)中国少数民族名。
(6)姓。明有畬恭。见《诏安县志》。

畭字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【田字部】　畭； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页763第14
【集韻】同畬。

畭字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
畭字的起名意思

暂无。

Shao
Basic explanation of words
Shao
shē
Gu Tong "She 1".
Shao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yú］
["Guangyun" is based on all cuts, flat fish, with. ]
Also known as "Sha 1".
(1) Fields that have been cultivated for three years, mature fields. "Poetry·Zhou Song·Chen Gong": "What do you want? How to new She." Mao Chuan: "Tian, two years old is new, three years old is she." One said it was a field that had been cultivated for two years. After referring to fields.
(2) Plowing the land to make mature fields.
[②] [shē]
["Guangyun" style car cut, flat hemp, book. ]
Also known as "Shaan 2". Also known as "She 1". Also known as "She 2".
(1) The original farming method of burning the vegetation in the field and using the ash of the vegetation as fertilizer.
(2) Broadly refers to extensive farming.
(3) Refers to extensively cultivated fields.
(4) Quantifiers.
(5) Chinese minority names.
(6) Last name. Ming has She Gong. See "Zhao'an County Chronicles".
Shao
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Wu Ji 1] [Tian Zi Department] 　畭; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: Page 763 14
【Jiyun】Same as She.
